column3: > 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

column1: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and spinach. Pour into prepared dish and bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until heated through and lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature!

column3: > 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

column1: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.

Transfer spinach mixture to a 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until heated through and lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature, with crackers or bread for dipping (see footnote for recipe link)

column3: > 1 (12 ounce) package fresh or frozen cranberries, 1 cup white sugar, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 3/4 cup water, <
column5: > In a saucepan over medium heat, stir together the sugar and corn starch. Gradually stir in the water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature before serving.

column3: > 1 (15 ounce) can pumpkin puree, 1/2 cup white sugar, 2 eggs, beaten, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or as needed, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch pie pan.

column1: Stir pumpkin, sugar, and eggs together in a bowl. Stir flour into pumpkin mixture until batter is smooth. Pour batter into the prepared pie dish and smooth the top using the back of a spoon. Cover the pie with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 45 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into wedges to serve

column3: > 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 3/4 cup butter, softened, 4 eggs, beaten, 5 bananas, mashed, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans.

column1: In a large bowl, stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl beat together butter and eggs until light and fluffy. Stir flour mixture into butter mixture until just combined. Fold in bananas. Pour batter into prepared pans, dividing evenly. Bake in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream, if desired

column3: > 1 spaghetti squash, halved lengthwise and seeded, 1/4 cup butter, melted, salt and ground black pepper to taste, 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

column1: Place squash cut-side down in a baking dish. Drizzle butter over squash. Season with salt, pepper, and cheese.

Bake in the preheated oven until squash is tender and lightly browned, about 45 minutes. Remove squash from oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes before cutting into wedges. Serve warm or at room temperature. Enjoy!

column3: > 1 cup butter, softened, 1 cup white sugar, 2 eggs, 3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 4 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets.

column1: In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Combine the cocoa and flour; stir into the creamed mixture until well blended. Roll dough into walnut sized balls and place them 2 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheet. Flatten slightly using the bottom of a glass dipped in sugar. Cookies should be about 1 inch apart. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to finish cooling on wire racks. When cookies are cool, store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks. These cookies keep well for several weeks in a cool place. They can also be stored between layers of waxed paper or plastic wrap and refrigerated until ready to use as soon as they come out of the next day. If you want to bake them. It's right away!

column3: > 1/2 cup ketchup, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, 3 tablespoons brown sugar, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, <
column5: > In a small saucepan over medium heat, stir together the barbeque sauce, vinegar, and sugar. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature before using.

column3: > 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 (28 ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes, with liquid, 4 cups water, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until tender. Stir in tomatoes and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes.

column1: Stir in salt, pepper and cooked spaghetti. Simmer for an additional 10 to 15 minutes, or until sauce has thickened and coats the back of a spoon. Serve hot or cold. This sauce can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. If you want to reheat it, you can add a little extra water to thin it out a bit, if you like it too thick. It will thicken as it cools, so be careful not to overcook it!

column3: > 1 head cauliflower, cut into florets, 2 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and ground black pepper to taste, <
column5: > Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steaming insert. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the whole head broccoli, cover, and steam until tender, 5 to 10 minutes.

column1: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat; whisk in the flour until smooth. Gradually whisk the milk into the roux, whisking constantly until the mixture is thick and smooth, about 5 minutes more. Season with salt, pepper and more flour, if desired. Serve hot, sprinkled with fresh chopped parsley to garnish (see Cook's Note).

column3: > 1 pound ground beef, 1 onion, chopped, 2 (15 ounce) cans kidney beans, rinsed and drained, 3/4 cup ketchup, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink, about 10 minutes. Drain and discard any excess grease.

column1: Stir beans into the beef mixture and cook until heated through, 5 to 7 minutes; season with salt, pepper and a little more chili powder if desired. Reduce heat to low and simmer until the beans are hot and the chili is thickened, 15 to 20 minutes more. Stir to blend the flavors before serving; allow to cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour or up to overnight. Serve chili with tortilla chips or on a bed of your favorite toppings such as: shredded Cheddar cheese, shredded lettuce, salsa, sour cream and salsa verde toffee bits, sliced ripe avocado slices and/or guacamole

column3: > 1 (15 ounce) can pumpkin puree, 1/2 cup white sugar, 2 eggs, beaten, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or as needed, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch pie pan.

column1: Stir pumpkin, sugar, and eggs together in a bowl. Stir flour into pumpkin mixture until batter is smooth. Pour batter into the prepared pie dish and smooth the top using the back of a spoon. Cover the pie with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 45 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into wedges to serve

column3: > 1 (18.25 ounce) package chocolate cake mix, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 4 eggs, 3/4 cup water, 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.

column1: In a large bowl, mix together cake batter, oil, eggs and water until smooth. Stir in chocolate morsels. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Allow to cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing from pan to finish cooling on a wire rack. When cake is cool, cut into 1 inch slices and serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream. If desired, dust with confectioners' sugar or sprinkles of your choice!

column3: > 1 (15 ounce) can pumpkin puree, 1/2 cup white sugar, 2 eggs, beaten, 3/4 cup half-and-half cream, 4 cups cubed day-old bread, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

column1: In a large bowl, combine pumpkin, sugar and eggs. Stir in half and half. Add bread cubes and stir to coat. Pour into prepared dish and bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Serve cold. Enjoy!

column3: > 1 (12 ounce) package fresh or frozen cranberries, 1 cup white sugar, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 3/4 cup water, <
column5: > In a saucepan over medium heat, stir together the sugar and corn starch. Gradually stir in the water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature before serving.

column3: > 1 (12 ounce) package fresh or frozen cranberries, 1 cup white sugar, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 3/4 cup water, <
column5: > In a medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together the sugar, corn starch and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature before using.

column3: > 1 pound lean ground beef, 1 onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 3 (14.5 ounce) cans stewed tomatoes, undrained, 4 cups water, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > In a large pot over medium heat, cook beef, onion and garlic until beef is brown. Stir in tomatoes and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes.

column1: Stir in salt, pepper and tomato sauce. Simmer until sauce is thickened and flavors are well blended, about 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. If sauce becomes too thick, add more water to thin it out to desired consistency. Serve hot, or refrigerate and reheat before serving. Enjoy!

column3: > 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 1/4 cup sweet pickle relish, 2 tablespoons prepared yellow mustard, 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.

column1: In a small bowl, mix together the mayo, sweet dill, mustard and 1 tablespoon of the prepared mustard. Spread the mixture onto the chicken breasts. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and remaining mustard mixture. Grill for 10 to 15 minutes on each side, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Remove from heat and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before cutting into bite-size pieces. Serve on a bed of lettuce with slices of tomato and/or cucumber for squeezing over the top of each piece of chicken during the last few minutes of grilling. Enjoy!

column3: > 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 3 (28 ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes, with liquid, 4 cups water, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until tender. Stir in tomatoes and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes.

column1: Stir in salt, pepper and tomato sauce. Simmer until sauce thickens and coats the back of a spoon, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes more. Serve hot or cold. This sauce will keep for several weeks in the refrigerator. If you want to reheat, add a little water to thin it out and it will thicken as it cools. You may not need all of the water, but I like to add more than 1/2 cup of water until it reaches your desired consistency. It should not be too thick or too soupy, so you may need more or less. Enjoy!

column3: > 1 (16 ounce) package ziti pasta, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 3/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

column1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.

Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until onion is tender. Stir in cooked pasta. Season with salt, pepper, and fresh herbs. Transfer to an 8x8 inch casserole dish and bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, until bubbly and lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature, or cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Top with freshly grated Romano or Parmesan cheese, if desired;

column3: > 2 ripe avocados, halved, pitted, peeled, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 1 small red onion, finely chopped, 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper, <
column5: > Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl; season with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.

column1: Combines all vegetables in an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or using a hand mixer) or with a handheld mixer, just until combined, about 30 seconds. Add 1 to 2 teaspoons water if needed to adjust consistency. Refrigerate until ready to serve. <

column3: > 1 (12 ounce) package fresh or frozen cranberries, 1 cup white sugar, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 3/4 cup water, <
column5: > In a medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together the sugar, corn starch and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature before using.

column3: > 1 pound lean ground beef, 1 onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 3 (14.5 ounce) cans stewed tomatoes, undrained, 4 cups water, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > In a large pot over medium heat, cook beef, onion and garlic until beef is brown. Stir in tomatoes and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes.

column1: Stir in salt, pepper and tomato sauce. Simmer until sauce is thickened and flavors are well blended, about 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. If sauce becomes too thick, add more water to thin it out to desired consistency. Serve hot, or refrigerate and reheat before serving. Enjoy!

column3: > 1 (16 ounce) package ziti pasta, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 3/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

column1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.

Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until onion is tender. Stir in cooked pasta. Season with salt, pepper, and fresh herbs. Transfer to an 8x8 inch casserole dish and bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, until bubbly and lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature, or cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Top with freshly grated Romano or Parmesan cheese, if desired;

column3: > 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 3/4 pound lean ground beef, 4 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with juice, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in beef and cook until beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.

column1: Stir in tomatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce is thickened and flavors have blended, 15 to 20 minutes; season with salt, pepper and additional salt if desired. If sauce becomes too thick, add more tomato juice, if it seems too dry, then add a little water to thin it out a bit. Serve hot or at room temperature. This sauce can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. It will thicken as it cools, so be sure to reheat before using it!

column3: > 1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, with liquid, 1 onion, chopped, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the tomatoes and liquid. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.

column1: Stir in the onion and garlic and continue to simmer until the liquid is reduced by half. Season with salt, pepper, and a little bit more liquid if desired. Serve hot or cold. This sauce can be refrigerated in a covered container for up to 3 days. If you are not serving immediately, let the sauce come to room temperature before serving. It will thicken as it cools, so be careful not to overcook it!

column3: > 1 pound ground beef, 1 (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix, 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

column1: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook and stir beef until evenly browned. Drain excess grease, and mix in seasoning packet. Transfer beef mixture to the prepared pan. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into wedges to serve. Enjoy!

column3: > 1 1/2 pounds ground beef, 1 onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, salt and pepper to taste, 4 hamburger buns, split, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

column1: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook and stir beef, onion and garlic until beef is evenly brown. Drain excess grease. Season with salt, pepper and a little salt.
Arrange the beef mixture in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with the bun halves. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until heated through and lightly browned. Serve with your favorite dippers!

column3: > 1 head cauliflower, cut into florets, 2 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and ground black pepper to taste, <
column5: > Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steaming insert. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the whole head broccoli, cover, and steam until tender, about 5 minutes.

column1: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat; whisk in the flour until smooth. Gradually whisk the milk into the roux, whisking constantly, until the mixture is thickened and bubbling, 5 to 10 minutes more. Season with salt, pepper and more flour, if desired. Serve hot, sprinkled with fresh chopped parsley to garnish, or with a dollop of creme fraiche on the side for the final few minutes of cooking to allow the sauce to thicken as it cools. Garnish with freshly grated Parmesan cheese and fresh lemon zest if you like. Enjoy!

column3: > 1 (12 ounce) package fresh or frozen cranberries, 1 cup white sugar, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 3/4 cup water, <
column5: > In a saucepan over medium heat, stir together the sugar and corn starch. Gradually stir in the water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature before serving.

column3: > 1 cup butter, softened, 1 cup white sugar, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 4 cups all-purpose flour, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

column1: In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Stir in the vanilla. Combine the flour and baking powder; stir into the creamed mixture until well blended. Roll dough into walnut sized balls and place them 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten slightly using the bottom of a glass dipped in sugar.

Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to finish cooling on wire racks. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks. These cookies keep well for several weeks in a cool, dry place, so be sure to remove any unmelted cookies that may be stuck to the sides of the pan before they are done. If you are not using immediately, you can refrigerate them until ready to eat them. They keep for a week in resealable plastic bag and can be stored at room temperature for future use. It will keep very well. You can also freeze them for another week if you will do this one week, but can do it for the next day, or freeze it in two weeks, and keep the other dishes, then keep them to thawed for months. The next to all of time. I'mores. This recipe is a great on the recipes that way to my family is to me, if it, which is the first one of your favorite ingredients. Enjoy it is not for all the ""s. <

column3: > 1 head cauliflower, cut into florets, 2 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and ground black pepper to taste, <
column5: > Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steaming water. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and steam until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.

column1: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat; whisk flour into melted butter until smooth. Slowly pour milk into flour mixture while whisking constantly until mixture is thickened and bubbling, 5 to 10 minutes more. Season soup with salt, pepper and more milk, if desired, until desired consistency is reached. Ladle soup into serving bowls and garnish each serving with a dollop of butter and a sprinkling of flour to serve;

column3: > 1 1/2 pounds small red-skinned potatoes (yams), scrubbed, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 400°F. Place potatoes in large bowl. Drizzle oil over. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Spread potatoes out in single layer on rimmed baking sheet. Roast potatoes until tender and golden brown, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes. Transfer potatoes to platter and serve warm or at room temperature.; <

column3: > 1/2 cup olive oil, 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme, Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, 4 medium zucchini, trimmed, halved lengthwise, and cut crosswise into 1-inch-thick slices, 3 medium red bell peppers, cored, seeded and thinly sliced, 8 ounces cremini mushrooms, stemmed and quartered (about 2 cups), 1 small red onion, cut into wedges, <
column5: > Watch how to make this recipe.

column1: In a large bowl, whisk together the first 6 ingredients. Add the vegetables and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Serve at room temperature. <

column3: > 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1/2 cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®), 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 3/4 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

column1: Stir together the mayonnaise and hot sauce in a bowl until smooth. Stir in the cheese until well blended. Spread the mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Serve warm with crackers or celery sticks. Enjoy!

column3: > 1 pound tomatillos, husked, rinsed, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 1 serrano chile, stemmed, seeded if desired and minced (wear rubber gloves), 1 garlic clove, minced, 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 3/4 teaspoon salt, or to taste, <
column5: > In a blender purée all ingredients with salt until smooth. Sauce may be made 1 day ahead and chilled, covered. Bring sauce to room temperature before serving. Serve sauce with tortilla chips or grilled vegetables.; <

column3: > 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 2 sticks (1 cup) unsalted butter, at room temperature, 4 ounces semisweet chocolate, finely chopped (about 1 cup), 2/3 cup granulated sugar, plus more for sprinkling, 5 large eggs, separated, <
column5: > Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.

column1: Whisk the flour with the baking powder, salt and butter in a medium bowl. Beat the egg yolks in another bowl with a mixer on medium-high speed until pale and thick, about 2 minutes. Reduce the mixer speed to low; add the chocolate and beat until smooth. Add the sugar and continue beating until the mixture is light and fluffy, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. The mixture should be noticeably lighter in color. Gradually beat in the yolk mixture, then the whites in 2 additions, beating just until incorporated. Divide the dough in half. Roll each half into a log, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm, 8 hours or up to 1 day. (the next day).
Cut each log into 1-inch-thick slices and place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake until golden brown around the edges. Transfer to a rack. Let cool completely. Store in an airtight containers. <

column3: > 1 cup butter, softened, 1/2 cup peanut butter, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 3/4 cup confectioners' sugar, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets.

column1: In a large bowl, cream together the butter or margarine and peanut or butter until smooth. Stir in the flour a little at a time, mixing well after each addition. Roll the dough into walnut sized balls and place them 2 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheet. Flatten slightly with the bottom of a glass dipped in sugar. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to finish cooling on wire racks. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks. These cookies keep well for several weeks in a cool, dry place, so be sure to remove any unmelted cookies that stick to the pan before they are done. You can also do this by dipping your hands in boiling water for a pot of simmering water until you are ready to eat them. If you don't have a thermometer, you can make sure it. It's right away!

column3: > 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

column1: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat.

Transfer spinach mixture to an 8x8 inch baking dish. Season with salt, pepper and a little salt. Cover with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until heated through and lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature, with crackers or on the side of the dish as a topping for your favorite dippers!

column3: > 1 head cauliflower, cut into florets, 2 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and ground black pepper to taste, <
column5: > Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steaming water. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and steam until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.

column1: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat; whisk flour into melted butter until smooth. Slowly pour milk into flour mixture while whisking constantly until mixture is thickened and bubbling, 5 to 10 minutes more. Season soup with salt, pepper and more milk, if desired, until desired consistency is reached. Ladle soup into serving bowls and garnish each serving with a dollop of butter and a sprinkling of flour to serve;

column3: > 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 3/4 cup butter, softened, 4 eggs, beaten, 5 bananas, mashed, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans.

column1: In a large bowl, stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl beat together butter and eggs until light and fluffy. Stir flour mixture into butter mixture until just combined. Fold in bananas. Pour batter into prepared pans, dividing evenly. Bake in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream, if desired

column3: > 1 1/2 cups water, 1 cup uncooked white rice, 2 cups frozen green peas, thawed, 3/4 cup chopped red bell pepper, 4 green onions, chopped, white parts and tops separated from green tops, salt and ground black pepper to taste, <
column5: > Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes; fluff with a fork.

column1: Stir peas and red pepper into the cooked rice. Season with green onion tops and season with salt. Chill in refrigerator until chilled, at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour. Stir before serving. Sprinkle with additional salt, pepper, or more pepper if you like your salad spicy!

column3: > 1 (12 ounce) package fresh or frozen cranberries, 1 cup white sugar, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 3/4 cup water, <
column5: > In a medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together the sugar, corn starch and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature before using.

column3: > 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

column1: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and spinach. Pour into prepared dish and bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until heated through and lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature!

column3: > 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, <
column5: > In a medium bowl, beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the vanilla.

column3: > 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 3/4 cup white sugar, 6 tablespoons butter, melted, 4 eggs, beaten, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.

column1: In a large bowl, stir together flour, baking soda, salt and sugar. Make a well in the center and pour in butter and eggs. Mix until smooth. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week. Yield: about 1 cup

column3: > 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

column1: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and spinach. Pour into prepared dish and bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until heated through and lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature!

column3: > 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, 4 cups fresh broccoli florets, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 2 quart casserole dish.

column1: In a medium bowl, mix together the soup, mayo, cheese and broccoli. Pour into the prepared dish and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until bubbly and lightly browned on the top. Serve hot!

column3: > 1 (18.25 ounce) package chocolate cake mix, 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 4 eggs, 3/4 cup water, 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.

column1: In a large bowl, mix together cake batter, oil, eggs and water until smooth. Stir in chocolate morsels. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Allow to cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing from pan to finish cooling on a wire rack. When cake is cool, cut into 1 inch slices and serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream. If desired, dust with confectioners' sugar or sprinkles of your choice!

column3: > 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 3 cups milk, salt and pepper to taste, <
column5: > Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

column1: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and spinach. Pour into prepared dish and bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until heated through and lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature!
